intro: Acinodendron prasinum, commonly known as the green acinodendron, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and smooth, often hairy leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Acinodendron prasinum is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
